persona.name: Dr. Emily Morales
persona.description: A 45-year-old behavioral therapist based in San Francisco, Dr. Emily Morales specializes in cognitive-behavioral therapy and has extensive experience in using techniques like role-playing and behavior shaping. She holds a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from Stanford University and has over 15 years of clinical experience. Her interests include integrating technology in therapy sessions and exploring innovative therapeutic methods. Emily is proficient with digital therapeutic tools and believes in a client-centered approach to therapy. Her unique perspective lies in her ability to blend traditional techniques with modern technology, making her contributions invaluable in understanding the application of behavioral therapies.

persona.name: Rebecca Sanchez
persona.description: Rebecca is a 38-year-old vocational counselor based in Austin, Texas. She holds a master's degree in Counseling Psychology from the University of Texas. With over 15 years of experience in career counseling, Rebecca specializes in using the GATB and other aptitude assessments to help individuals navigate career transitions. She has worked extensively with both young adults entering the workforce and older professionals seeking career changes. Rebecca has a keen interest in the intersection of psychology and technology, frequently incorporating modern software tools to enhance her counseling sessions. Her unique perspective stems from her experience in working with diverse populations, including veterans and individuals with disabilities.

persona.name: Mr. Jason Singh
persona.description: Mr. Jason Singh is a 32-year-old licensed therapist from Chicago with a Master's degree in Counseling Psychology. Jason utilizes behavior shaping and systematic desensitization to address anxiety and behavioral issues. He is passionate about youth advocacy and empowerment, emphasizing preventive mental health care.
